intro: Terminalia manii, commonly known as African snowball, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its distinctive clusters of white, fluffy flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, open woodlands. Terminalia manii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
